```{r}
rm(list = ls())
df = read.csv("machine_learning_week_0.csv", header = TRUE)
# find two largest variance columns
vn1 = .Machine$double.xmin
vn2 = .Machine$double.xmin

find_variance3 <- function(df) {
  v1 = 0
  v2 = 0
  for (i in colnames(df)) {
    v0 = var(df[i])
    print(v0)
    if (v0 > v1) {
      v2 = v1
      v1 = v0
      vn1 <<- i
    } else if (v0 > v2) {
      df[vn2] <- NULL
      v2 = v0
      vn2 <<- i
    }
  }
  }


find_variance2 <- function(df) {
  list <- c()
  v1 = 0
  v2 = 0
  for (i in colnames(df)) {
    v0 = var(df[i])
    if (v0 > v1) {
      v2 = v1
      v1 = v0
      vn1 <<- i
    } else if (v0 > v2) {
      df[vn2] <- NULL
      v2 = v0
      vn2 <<- i
    }
    list <- c(list, v0)
  }
  return(list)
}

print(vn1)
print(vn2)

find_variance3(df)

#plot((df[vn1,]), (df[vn2,]), main = "Exercise 5")
```
